result.execSummary:
The defendant Deonte L Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Early termination after 3 yrs if no new charges or ATR.

Preliminary hearing on February 18, 2014 at 09:30 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with co-defendant.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

 - The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $7500.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
